records.location_details: Incident occurred near the Albanian-Greek border. The migrant was apprehended by Albanian police, transferred to a detention center in the vicinity of a redacted location, then transported to a location with a small wooden bridge and a monastery nearby, before being directed towards the Greek border. The Office corroborated the existence of an abandoned bridge and a monastery close-by in the estimated area.
records.where_clear: Albanian-Greek border area, involving a detention center in Albania.
records.location_text_raw: Greek-Albanian border on foot in the area of [REDACTED]
records.uncertainty_note: Significant redactions and vague descriptions like 'vicinity of', 'nearby', 'closer to the Greek border', and 'estimated location' prevent precise geocoding. While an abandoned bridge and monastery were corroborated, their specific locations are redacted.

possible_violations.legal_basis: Art. 4 of Protocol no. 4 of the European Convention on Human Rights

records.context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office received information from Frontex operational staff about a migrant who alleged being apprehended by Albanian police on 15/03/2023. The migrant and their group were allegedly transferred to a detention center, photographed, and later transported to the Greek border. The Albanian authorities denied the collective expulsion, stating that the group was interviewed, photographed, fingerprinted, and issued an Order of Voluntary Removal on 13.03.2023, then 'left free in the territory of Albania'. The FRO notes discrepancies in dates and locations but finds the migrant's account relatively credible, consistent with previous SIRs regarding irregular returns by Albanian officers to Greece. The FRO concludes it is possible the group was irregularly returned to Greece by Albanian officers.
records.evidence_quote: Based on the available information the Fundamental Rights Office finds it possible that the group of migrants in the case under scrutiny was irregularly returned to Greece by Albanian officers.
